amendment.description: Amendment sought to strike section 203, and replace it with a Sense of Congress that the Commodities Future Trading Commission is already required by law to consider costs and benefits when promulgating rules and issuing orders, and is held accountable to this requirement by courts.
amendment.purpose: An amendment No 5. printed in House Report 113-476 to strike Section 203, and replace it with a Sense of Congress that the Commodities Future Trading Commission is already required by law to consider costs and benefits when promulgating rules and issuing orders, and is held accountable to this requirement by courts.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Moore amendment (A005) Failed by recorded vote: 173 - 239 (Roll no. 345).
